content:
DataGridLength Struct

In this Article

Represents the lengths of elements within the DataGrid control.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthConverter))]
public struct DataGridLength : IEquatable<System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength>

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • DataGridLength

Constructors summary

DataGridLength(Double)

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridLength class with an absolute value in pixels.
DataGridLength(Double,DataGridLengthUnitType)

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridLength class with a specified value and unit.
DataGridLength(Double,DataGridLengthUnitType,Double,Double)

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridLength class with the specified value, unit, desired value, and display value.

Properties summary

Auto

Gets a DataGridLength structure that represents the standard automatic sizing mode.
DesiredValue

Gets the calculated pixel value needed for the element.
DisplayValue

Gets the pixel value allocated for the size of the element.
IsAbsolute

Gets a value that indicates whether this instance sizes elements based on a fixed pixel value.
IsAuto

Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on both the content of cells and the column headers.
IsSizeToCells

Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on the content of the cells.
IsSizeToHeader

Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on the header.
IsStar

Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on a weighted proportion of available space.
SizeToCells

Gets a DataGridLength structure that represents the cell-based automatic sizing mode.
SizeToHeader

Gets a DataGridLength structure that represents the header-based automatic sizing mode.
UnitType

Gets the type that is used to determine how the size of the element is calculated.
Value

Gets the absolute value of the DataGridLength in pixels.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current DataGridLength.
Equals(DataGridLength)

Determines whether the specified DataGridLength is equal to the current DataGridLength.
GetHashCode()

Gets a hash code for the DataGridLength.
ToString()

Returns a string that represents the current object.

Operators summary

op_Equality(DataGridLength,DataGridLength)

Compares two DataGridLength structures for equality.
op_Implicit(Double)
op_Inequality(DataGridLength,DataGridLength)

Compares two DataGridLength structures to determine whether they are not equal.

Constructors

  • DataGridLength(Double)

    Initializes a new instance of the DataGridLength class with an absolute value in pixels.

    public DataGridLength (double pixels);

    Parameters

    • pixels
      Double

      The absolute pixel value (96 pixels-per-inch) to initialize the length to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      pixels is Double, Double, or Double.

  • DataGridLength(Double,DataGridLengthUnitType)

    Initializes a new instance of the DataGridLength class with a specified value and unit.

    public DataGridLength (double value, System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType type);

    Parameters

    • value
      Double

      The requested size of the element.

    • type
      DataGridLengthUnitType

      The type that is used to determine how the size of the element is calculated.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      value is Double, Double, or Double.

      -or-

      type is not DataGridLengthUnitType, DataGridLengthUnitType, DataGridLengthUnitType, DataGridLengthUnitType, or DataGridLengthUnitType.

  • DataGridLength(Double,DataGridLengthUnitType,Double,Double)

    Initializes a new instance of the DataGridLength class with the specified value, unit, desired value, and display value.

    public DataGridLength (double value, System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType type, double desiredValue, double displayValue);

    Parameters

    • value
      Double

      The requested size of the element.

    • type
      DataGridLengthUnitType

      The type that is used to determine how the size of the element is calculated.

    • desiredValue
      Double

      The calculated size needed for the element.

    • displayValue
      Double

      The allocated size for the element.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      value is Double, Double, or Double.

      -or-

      type is not DataGridLengthUnitType, DataGridLengthUnitType, DataGridLengthUnitType, DataGridLengthUnitType, or DataGridLengthUnitType.

      -or-

      desiredValue is NegativeInfinity or PositiveInfinity.

      -or-

      displayValue is NegativeInfinity or PositiveInfinity.

Properties

  • Auto

    Gets a DataGridLength structure that represents the standard automatic sizing mode.

    public static System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength Auto { get; }

    Property Value

    • DataGridLength

      A DataGridLength structure that represents the standard automatic sizing mode.

    Remarks

    The standard automatic sizing mode sizes DataGrid columns based on the contents of both cells and column headers.

  • DesiredValue

    Gets the calculated pixel value needed for the element.

    public double DesiredValue { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The number of pixels calculated for the size of the element.

  • DisplayValue

    Gets the pixel value allocated for the size of the element.

    public double DisplayValue { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The number of pixels allocated for the element.

  • IsAbsolute

    Gets a value that indicates whether this instance sizes elements based on a fixed pixel value.

    public bool IsAbsolute { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType* property is set to DataGridLengthUnitType; otherwise, false.

  • IsAuto

    Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on both the content of cells and the column headers.

    public bool IsAuto { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType* property is set to DataGridLengthUnitType; otherwise, false.

  • IsSizeToCells

    Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on the content of the cells.

    public bool IsSizeToCells { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType* property is set to DataGridLengthUnitType; otherwise, false.

  • IsSizeToHeader

    Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on the header.

    public bool IsSizeToHeader { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType* property is set to DataGridLengthUnitType; otherwise, false.

  • IsStar

    Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on a weighted proportion of available space.

    public bool IsStar { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType* property is set to DataGridLengthUnitType; otherwise, false.

  • SizeToCells

    Gets a DataGridLength structure that represents the cell-based automatic sizing mode.

    public static System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength SizeToCells { get; }

    Property Value

    • DataGridLength

      A DataGridLength structure that represents the cell-based automatic sizing mode.

    Remarks

    The cell-based automatic sizing mode sizes DataGrid columns based on the contents of cells in the column, not including column headers. This sizing mode will cause columns to expand if content that is larger than the current column size is scrolled into view. The column will not shrink after the content is scrolled out of view.

  • SizeToHeader

    Gets a DataGridLength structure that represents the header-based automatic sizing mode.

    public static System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength SizeToHeader { get; }

    Property Value

    • DataGridLength

      A DataGridLength structure that represents the header-based automatic sizing mode.

    Remarks

    The header-based automatic sizing mode sizes DataGrid columns based on the contents of column headers only.

  • UnitType

    Gets the type that is used to determine how the size of the element is calculated.

    public System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType UnitType { get; }

    Property Value

    • DataGridLengthUnitType

      A type that represents how size is determined.

  • Value

    Gets the absolute value of the DataGridLength in pixels.

    public double Value { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The absolute value of the DataGridLength in pixels, or 1.0 if the stem.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType* property is set to DataGridLengthUnitType.

Methods

  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current DataGridLength.

    public override bool Equals (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The object to compare to the current instance.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified object is a DataGridLength with the same value or sizing mode as the current DataGridLength; otherwise, false.

  • Equals(DataGridLength)

    Determines whether the specified DataGridLength is equal to the current DataGridLength.

    public bool Equals (System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength other);

    Parameters

    • other
      DataGridLength

      The DataGridLength to compare to the current instance.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified object is a DataGridLength with the same value or sizing mode as the current DataGridLength; otherwise, false.

  • GetHashCode()

    Gets a hash code for the DataGridLength.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A hash code for the current DataGridLength.

  • ToString()

    Returns a string that represents the current object.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A string that represent the current object.

Operators

  • op_Equality(DataGridLength,DataGridLength)

    Compares two DataGridLength structures for equality.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength gl1, System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength gl2);

    Parameters

    • gl1
      DataGridLength

      The first DataGridLength instance to compare.

    • gl2
      DataGridLength

      The second DataGridLength instance to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the two DataGridLength instances have the same value or sizing mode; otherwise, false.

  • op_Implicit(Double)
    public static System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength op_Implicit (double value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Double

      To be added.

    Returns

    • DataGridLength

      To be added.

  • op_Inequality(DataGridLength,DataGridLength)

    Compares two DataGridLength structures to determine whether they are not equal.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength gl1, System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength gl2);

    Parameters

    • gl1
      DataGridLength

      The first DataGridLength instance to compare.

    • gl2
      DataGridLength

      The second DataGridLength instance to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the two DataGridLength instances do not have the same value or sizing mode; otherwise, false.
